description: From Ancient Greek κορβᾶν (korbân), from Hebrew קורבן \ קָרְבָּן‎ (korbán, “offering, sacrifice”). Found in the Bible at Mark 7.11. Doublet of Qurbana.

nouns.description: corban (plural corbans or corbanot or corbanoth)

entries.meaning: An offering to God, especially in fulfilment of a vow.
examples: but ye say, If a man shall say to his father or his mother, That wherewith thou mightest have been profited by me is Corban, that is to say, Given [to God];

entries.meaning: An alms basket; a vessel to receive gifts of charity; a treasury of the church, where offerings are deposited.
